message: Internal logins to PTAB E2E are currently unavailable due to a Role-Based Access Control system (RBAC) outage; however external users can still access and use PTAB E2E. Please check eBiz page for additional details.

events.author: ServiceDesk
events.title: Current Events
events.content:
EFS-Web Acknowledgement Receipt delays affecting some filers 

Recently there have been Acknowledgement Receipt delays for some filers. If you did not receive an Acknowledgement Receipt after payment of fees, please follow the steps below to confirm that EFS-Web has received your submission and payment:

  1. Registered users can access EFS-Web My Workplace > Last 40 Acknowledgement Receipts which shows the Application Number, Receipt Date, Title of Invention, and other pertinent information for your last 40 applications and follow-on submissions.  If the Acknowledgement Receipt was generated, you can select "View" to display it. If the Acknowledgement Receipt is not ready, the Receipt column will display "In Progress". 

  2. EFS-Web received your submission if you see it listed under Last 40 Acknowledgement Receipts, even if the status is "In Progress”. Please do not file your submission again while waiting for EFS-Web to generate the Acknowledgement Receipt, because duplicate submissions may result in processing delays and non-refundable fees. Generation of the acknowledgement receipt could take up to 5 business days.

  3. Please confirm payment status before submitting payment again. Filers who paid using a stored payment method established in Financial Manager can access it to confirm whether payments were successfully processed. You can confirm credit/debit card transactions via the credit card or bank’s website.

  4. For ePetition and eTerminal Disclaimers, if you did not receive a grant letter or approval letter at the time of filing, please try to file your submission again at a later time. When re-submitting, you can certify that fees were previously paid for certain fees. If this option is not available, you will be required to pay again and request a refund for the payments that accompanied the failed ePetition/eTerminal Disclaimer submission.

For assistance with EFS-Web, please contact the Patent Electronic Business Center (EBC) at ebc@uspto.gov or 866-217-9197 from 6 a.m. to 12 Midnight Eastern Time, Monday - Friday.

For assistance with EFS-Web, please contact the Patent Electronic Business Center (EBC) at ebc@uspto.gov or 866-217-9197 from 6 a.m. to 12 Midnight Eastern Time, Monday - Friday.

Public PAIR Emergency Reboot

The USPTO will perform maintenance on Public Patent Application Information Retrieval (Public PAIR) beginning at midnight, Thursday, January 8 and ending at 5 a.m., Thursday, January 8 ET.

The following applications will not be available due to an emergency device reboot:

  • Public PAIR
  • Publication Site for Issued and Published Sequences (PSIPS)
  • Patent Examination Data Search (PEDS)
  • Global Dossier (GD)
  • One Portal Dossier (OPD)
  • Trilateral Document Access (TDA)
  • File Inspection Utility (FIU)
  • Quality Review System (QRS)
  • PALM PTA Service

events.author: Service Desk Branch
events.title: Current Events
events.content:
USPTO.gov Account Authentication with PIN sent via SMS or phone call is intermittently Unavailable or Delayed

Authentication to EFS-Web, Private PAIR, and the Sponsorship tool, using a USPTO.gov account with PIN sent via SMS or phone call is intermittently unavailable or delayed.

Please use the mobile authenticator or email option to receive the second factor PIN for your USPTO.gov account.

Please use EFS-Web for Unregistered eFilers to file new applications and use an alternative filing method to file follow-on submissions.

The USPTO is aware of this issue and is working to resolve it.

EFS-Web Acknowledgement Receipt delays affecting some filers

If the Acknowledgement Receipt is not ready, the Receipt column will display "In Progress". 

  2. EFS-Web received your submission if you see it listed under Last 40 Acknowledgement Receipts, even if the status is "In Progress”. Please do not file your submission again while waiting for EFS-Web to generate the Acknowledgement Receipt, because duplicate submissions may result in processing delays and non-refundable fees. Generation of the acknowledgement receipt could take up to 5 business days.

  3. Please confirm payment status before submitting payment again. Filers who paid using a stored payment method established in Financial Manager can access it to confirm whether payments were successfully processed. You can confirm credit/debit card transactions via the credit card or bank’s website.

  4. For ePetition and eTerminal Disclaimers, if you did not receive a grant letter or approval letter at the time of filing, please try to file your submission again at a later time. When re-submitting, you can certify that fees were previously paid for certain fees. If this option is not available, you will be required to pay again and request a refund for the payments that accompanied the failed ePetition/eTerminal Disclaimer submission.

For assistance with EFS-Web, please contact the Patent Electronic Business Center (EBC) at ebc@uspto.gov or 866-217-9197 from 6 a.m. to 12 Midnight Eastern Time, Monday - Friday.

events.author: Service Desk Branch
events.title: Updated: Fee Payment Processing/FPNG
events.content:
Updated: Fee Payment Processing/FPNG

 

Fee Payment Processing/FPNG

The USPTO will perform system maintenance on the Deposit Account payment processing beginning at midnight, Saturday, December 14 and ending at 4 a.m., Monday, December 16 ET.

Due to system maintenance, Deposit Account payment processing across the USPTO storefronts noted below will be unavailable during the maintenance period. Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) payment processing and Credit Card payment processing will remain available during the maintenance window.

  • Electronic Filing System-Web-Contingency (EFS-Web/EFS-Web Contingency)
  • Patent Center
  • Patent Trial and Appeal Board End-to-End (PTAB-E2E)
  • Trademark Electronic Application System (TEAS)
  • Trademark Electronic Application System (International)(TEASI)
  • Electronic System for Trademark Trials and Appeals (ESTTA)
  • Electronic Trademark Assignment Search (ETAS)
  • Certified Copy Center (CCC)
  • Office of Enrollment and Discipline Roster (OEDCI)
  • Patent Maintenance Fees Storefront including bulk file submissions

In addition, credit card and EFT fee payment transactions processed during the maintenance period will not be reflected in Financial Manager stored payment statements/fee transaction queries until several hours after the maintenance concludes.

Please submit any deposit account payment using alternative methods, such as the following:

For Patents Customers:

Attaching a fee transmittal form (e.g., PTO/SB/17) with deposit account authorization in EFS-Web.

Facsimile submission of the basic national fee for national stage under 35 U.S.C. 371 is not accepted.

Submissions that require successful online payment, such as ePetitions and Pre-grant publication submissions, will be unavailable during the maintenance period.

If you have any questions, contact the Patent EBC by phone at 866-217-9197 or by email at ebc@uspto.gov.

For PTAB Customers:

Patent Trial and Appeal Board End-to-End (PTAB-E2E) will be available for use (uploading and downloading files and searching) but a petitioner will not be able to pay for their newly created petitions if paying using a Deposit Account.

Please pay for your newly filed petitions when Financial Manager is available.

If your deadline is today for the petition filing and/or other associated documents to a pending America Invents Act (AIA) case and you cannot file electronically via the PTAB-E2E, you may use an alternative filing method.

Please visit the PTAB-E2E FAQ page https://www.uspto.gov/patents-application-process/patent-trial-and-appeal-board/ptab-e2e-frequently-asked-questions and see A2 for information concerning your AIA petition filing and/or document filing using PTAB-E2E alternative filing methods.

If you have any questions, contact PTAB during normal business hours of 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET by telephone at 571-272-7822 or email at Trials@uspto.gov (link sends e-mail).

For Trademarks Customers:

If your deadline is today and the document requiring a fee payment cannot be filed electronically, you must use an alternative method of filing.

Please visit the Outage Page for information concerning Trademark alternative filing methods.

If you have any specific questions regarding Trademark Electronic Application System (Domestic)/Trademark Electronic Application System (International) (TEAS/TEASi), contact the TEAS Team by email at TEAS@uspto.gov.

All customers with an established EFT account or credit card will still be able to pay the required fees via those accounts. In addition, forms that do not require a fee payment can still be filed.

For TTAB Customers:

If your deadline is today and the document cannot be filed electronically, you must use an alternative filing method.

Please visit the TTAB Outage Page for information concerning Trademark Trial and Appeal Board (TTAB) alternative filing methods.

If you have any questions, contact the TTAB Assistance Center during normal business hours by telephone at 571-272-8500 or email TTABinfo@uspto.gov  (links send emails).

events.author: jkarthigairajan
events.title: Current Events
events.content:
EFS-Web Acknowledgement Receipt delays affecting some filers

Recently there have been Acknowledgement Receipt delays for some filers.

If you did not receive an Acknowledgement Receipt after payment of fees, please follow the steps below to confirm that EFS-Web has received your submission and payment:

  1. Registered users can access EFS-Web My Workplace > Last 40 Acknowledgement Receipts which shows the Application Number, Receipt Date, Title of Invention, and other pertinent information for your last 40 applications and follow-on submissions.  If the Acknowledgement Receipt was generated, you can select "View" to display it. If the Acknowledgement Receipt is not ready, the Receipt column will display "In Progress". 
  2. EFS-Web received your submission if you see it listed under Last 40 Acknowledgement Receipts, even if the status is "In Progress”. Please do not file your submission again while waiting for EFS-Web to generate the Acknowledgement Receipt, because duplicate submissions may result in processing delays and non-refundable fees. Generation of the acknowledgement receipt could take up to 5 business days. 
  3. Please confirm payment status before submitting payment again. Filers who paid using a stored payment method established in Financial Manager can access it to confirm whether payments were successfully processed. You can confirm credit/debit card transactions via the credit card or bank’s website.
  4. For ePetition and eTerminal Disclaimers, if you did not receive a grant letter or approval letter at the time of filing, please try to file your submission again at a later time. When re-submitting, you can certify that fees were previously paid for certain fees. If this option is not available, you will be required to pay again and request a refund for the payments that accompanied the failed ePetition/eTerminal Disclaimer submission.

For assistance with EFS-Web, please contact the Patent Electronic Business Center (EBC) at ebc@uspto.govor 866-217-9197 from 6 a.m. to 12 Midnight Eastern Time, Monday - Friday.

Security Update to Private PAIR

To reduce performance issues affecting USPTO systems, access to public applications not associated with your customer number is being removed in Private PAIR. Refer to the recent news brief, Securing USPTO online access for additional information. Please use Public PAIR or Patent Examination Data System for public application data.

Please contact the EBC if you have any questions at 866-217-9197 between 6 a.m. and midnight ET, Monday through Friday, or email ebc@uspto.gov.

events.author: ServiceDesk
events.title: Planned Events
events.content:
Open Data - Patent Assignment Search and Trademark Assignment Search Maintenance

The USPTO will be performing maintenance on Open Data - Patent Assignment Search and Trademark Assignment Search beginning at 12 a.m., Wednesday, December 4 and ending at 3 a.m., Wednesday, December 4 ET.

Open Data - Patent Assignment Search (https://assignment.uspto.gov/patent/index.html#/patent/search) and Trademark Assignment Search (https://assignment.uspto.gov/trademark/index.html#/trademark/search) will be unavailable during this maintenance period.

TSDR Maintenance

The USPTO will perform maintenance affecting Trademark Status and Document Retrieval (TSDR) beginning at 10 p.m., Saturday, December 7 and ending at 5 a.m., Sunday, December 8 ET.

TSDR will not be available during the maintenance. In addition, the following applications will have limited functionality.

  • Madrid
  • AOTW
  • MyUSPTO
  • TMNG-MobileApps
  • Certified Copy Center (CCC)

Links to TSDR will not be available from the following systems:

  • Trademark Electronic Application System (TEAS)
  • Trademark Electronic Application System International (TEASi)
  • Trademarks Electronic Official Gazette (TMOG)
  • Trademark Trial and Appeal Board Viewing on the Web (TTABVUE)
  • Trademark Electronic Search System (TESS)

PTAB Maintenance

The USPTO will perform API gateway patching and upgrade to the Patent Trial Appeal Board End-To-End (PTAB E2E) beginning at 12 a.m., Saturday, December 7 and ending at 5 a.m., Saturday, December 7 ET.

During the maintenance period, PTAB E2E will be unavailable.

Multiple System Maintenance

Systems Maintenance The USPTO will perform systems maintenance beginning at 12:01 a.m., Saturday, December 7 and ending at 1 a.m., Saturday, December 7 ET.

The following systems should be accessible, but may be unavailable:

  • my.uspto.gov website
  • Certified Copy Center (CCC)
  • Electronic Filing System (EFS-Web) for Registered eFilers
  • Private PAIR
  • Patent Practitioner Support Sponsorship Tool
  • Trademark Next Generation ID Manual (TMNG-IDM)
  • Trademark Next Generation Official Gazette (TMOG)
  • Trademark Electronic Application System (TEAS)
  • Trademark Electronic Application System International (TEASi)

The maintenance will cause an outage to Financial Manager, an outage to Patent Maintenance Fee Storefront, and an interruption to payment processing for all USPTO storefronts. Users of the following systems should not attempt to make a payment during the maintenance period:

  • Electronic Filing System (EFS-Web) for Unregistered eFilers and EFS-Web Contingency
  • Electronic System for Trademark Trials and Appeals (ESTTA)
  • Electronic Trademark Assignment Search (ETAS)
  • Patent Maintenance Fee Storefront
  • Patent Trial and Appeal Board End to End (PTAB E2E) For Patent

Customers:

During the maintenance period, if you need to file a new patent application, you can use EFS-Web for Unregistered eFilers or EFS-Web Contingency. If you need to file a follow-on submission or pay fees, use an alternative filing or payment method.

Please contact the EBC if you have any questions at 866-217-9197 between 6 a.m. and midnight ET, Monday through Friday, or email ebc@uspto.gov.

For PTAB Customers:

If your deadline is today for the petition filing and/or other associated documents to a pending AIA case and you cannot file electronically via the Patent Trial and Appeal Board End-to-End System (PTAB-E2E), you may use an alternative filing method. Please visit the PTAB-E2E FAQ page (https://www.uspto.gov/patents-application-process/patent-trial-and-appeal-board/ptab-e2e-frequently-asked-questions) and see A2 for information concerning your AIA petition filing and/or document filing using PTAB-E2E alternative filing methods.

If you have any questions, contact PTAB during normal business hours of 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET by telephone at 571-272-7822 or email at Trials@uspto.gov.

For Trademark Customers:

If your deadline is today and the document requiring a fee payment cannot be filed electronically, you must use an alternative method of filing. Please visit the Trademark Outage Page for information concerning Trademark alternative filing methods.

If you have any questions, contact the TEAS Team by email TEAS@uspto.gov.

For TTAB Customers:

If your deadline is today and the document cannot be filed electronically, you must use an alternative method of filing. Please visit the TTAB Outage Page for information concerning Trademark Trial and Appeal Board (TTAB) alternative filing methods.

If you have any questions, contact the TTAB Assistance Center during normal business hours between 8:30 a.m. and 5 p.m. Eastern Time, Monday through Friday, except federal holidays by telephone at 571-272-8500 or email TTABInfo@uspto.gov .

events.author: ServiceDesk
events.title: Current Events
events.content:
Private PAIR Unavailable

Private PAIR is currently unavailable. USPTO technical teams are investigating.

Security Update to Private PAIR

To reduce performance issues affecting USPTO systems, access to public applications not associated with your customer number is being removed in Private PAIR. Refer to the recent news brief, Securing USPTO online access for additional information. Please use Public PAIR or Patent Examination Data System for public application data.

Please contact the EBC if you have any questions at 866-217-9197 between 6 a.m. and midnight ET, Monday through Friday, or email ebc@uspto.gov.

USPTO.gov Login is Temporarily Unavailable

Authentication (login) to TEAS, EFS-Web for Registered eFilers, Private PAIR, and the Sponsorship tool is intermittently unavailable. Please retry at a later time.

EFS-Web for Unregistered eFilers to file new applications and use an alternative filing method to file follow-on submissions.

For trademark (TEAS) customers, if your deadline is today and you cannot login, you must use an alternative method of filing. Please visit the Trademark Outage Page for information concerning Trademark alternative filing methods. If you have any questions, contact the TEAS team by email TEAS@uspto.gov.

USPTO is aware of this issue and is working to resolve it.
